required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Study With Inzomelid
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled, Single and Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Determine the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Food Effect of Inzomelid in Healthy Adult Participants as Well as an Open Label Cohort to Confirm the Safety, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of Inzomelid in Adult Patients With Cryopyrin-Associated Periodic Syndromes

brief_summary.textblock: This is a first in human (FIH), single-centre, double blind, randomised, cross-over, SAD followed by a MAD study of Inzomelid. The study is designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, PD, and food effect of Inzomelid in healthy adult participants and to evaluate the safety, tolerability, PK, PD, and preliminary clinical efficacy of Inzomelid in adult patients with CAPS. Oversight will be provided by a safety monitoring committee (SMC) comprised of the Investigator, the Sponsor's Medical Monitor and an Independent Medical Monitor.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent advert events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1-8 for SAD, Day 1-16 for MAD
primary_outcome.description: Incidence, frequency and severity of treatment emergent advert events
Peak plasma concentration following single dose administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)- single dose

primary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration following multiple dose administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)- multiple dose

primary_outcome.description: Peak plasma concentration following multiple dose administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC)- multiple dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1-3 for SAD and Day 1-9 for MAD

secondary_outcome.description: Reduction in Physician Assessed CAPS scores based on 8 point questionnaire
